Medium: Steel, brass, silver, gold, wood, textile
Credit Line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Jerry D. Berger, 1983
Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History: The Decoration of Arms and Armor
The United States and Canada, 1800–1900 A.D.
Description: This finely engraved revolver was presented by Samuel Colt to Major Charles Traintor Baker (1821–1881), an officer in the Fifth Regiment of Connecticut Volunteers, at the outbreak of the Civil War.
Provenance: 1881, Major Baker's family - Mrs. G. Page Ely (his granddaughter) and her husband - 1965 W. W. Edmunds
